012package org.postgresql.pljava.example.annotation;
013
014import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLAction;
015import org.postgresql.pljava.annotation.SQLActions;
016
017/**
018 * Test of a very simple form of conditional execution in the deployment
019 * descriptor using only the {@code <implementor name>} specified for an
020 * {@code <implementor block>}.
021 * <p>
022 * When a deployment descriptor is executed, the config setting
023 * {@code pljava.implementors} determines which {@code <implementor block>}s
024 * will be executed (in addition to all of the plain {@code <SQL statement>}s
025 * that are not tagged with an implementor name). The default setting of
026 * {@code pljava.implementors} is simply {@code postgresql}.
027 * <p>
028 * In this example, an SQLAction (with the default implementor name PostgreSQL
029 * so it should always execute) tests some condition and, based on the result,
030 * adds {@code LifeIsGood} to the list of recognized implementor names.
031 * <p>
032 * Later SQLActions with that implementor name should also be executed, while
033 * those with a different, unrecognized implementor should not.
034 * <p>
035 * That is what happens at <em>deployment</em> (or undeployment) time, when the
036 * jar has been loaded into the target database and the deployment descriptor is
037 * being processed.
038 * <p>
039 * The {@code provides} and {@code requires} attributes matter at
040 * <em>compile</em> time: they are hints to the DDR generator so it will be sure
041 * to write the SQLAction that tests the condition ahead of the ones that
042 * depend on the condition having been tested. The example illustrates that an
043 * SQLAction's {@code implementor} is treated as an implicit {@code requires}.
044 * Unlike an explicit one, it is weak: if there is nothing declared that
045 * {@code provides} it, that's not an error; affected SQLActions will just be
046 * placed as late in the generated DDR as other dependencies allow, in case
047 * something in the preceding actions will be setting those implementor tags.
048 * <p>
049 * The implicit {@code requires} derived from an {@code implementor} is also
050 * special in another way: it does not have its sense reversed when generating
051 * the "undeploy" actions of the deployment descriptor. Ordinary requirements
052 * do, so the dependent objects get dropped before the things they depend on.
053 * But the code for setting a conditional implementor tag has to be placed
054 * ahead of the uses of the tag, whether deploying or undeploying.
055 * <p>
056 * An {@code SQLAction} setting an implementor tag does not need to have any
057 * {@code remove=} actions. If it does not (the usual case), its
058 * {@code install=} actions will be used in both sections of the deployment
059 * descriptor.
060 * <p>
061 * This example adds {@code LifeIsGood} ahead of the prior content of
062 * {@code pljava.implementors}. Simply replacing the value would stop the
063 * default implementor PostgreSQL being recognized, probably not what's wanted.
064 * The final {@code true} argument to {@code set_config} makes the setting
065 * local, so it is reverted when the transaction completes.
066 * <p>
067 * In addition to the goodness-of-life examples, this file also generates
068 * several statements setting PostgreSQL-version-based implementor tags that
069 * are relied on by various other examples in this directory.
070 */
071@SQLActions({
072    @SQLAction(provides={"LifeIsGood","LifeIsNotGood"}, install=
073        "SELECT CASE 42 WHEN 42 THEN " +
074        " set_config('pljava.implementors', 'LifeIsGood,' || " +
075        "  current_setting('pljava.implementors'), true) " +
076        "ELSE " +
077        " set_config('pljava.implementors', 'LifeIsNotGood,' || " +
078        "  current_setting('pljava.implementors'), true) " +
079        "END"
080    ),
081
082    @SQLAction(implementor="LifeIsGood", install=
083        "SELECT javatest.logmessage('INFO', 'Looking good!')"
084    ),
085
086    @SQLAction(implementor="LifeIsNotGood", install=
087        "SELECT javatest.logmessage('WARNING', 'This should not be executed')"
088    ),
089
090    @SQLAction(provides="postgresql_ge_80300", install=
091        "SELECT CASE WHEN" +
092        " 80300 <= CAST(current_setting('server_version_num') AS integer)" +
093        " THEN set_config('pljava.implementors', 'postgresql_ge_80300,' || " +
094        " current_setting('pljava.implementors'), true) " +
095        "END"
096    ),
097
098    @SQLAction(provides="postgresql_ge_80400", install=
099        "SELECT CASE WHEN" +
100        " 80400 <= CAST(current_setting('server_version_num') AS integer)" +
101        " THEN set_config('pljava.implementors', 'postgresql_ge_80400,' || " +
102        " current_setting('pljava.implementors'), true) " +
103        "END"
104    ),
105
106    @SQLAction(provides="postgresql_ge_90000", install=
107        "SELECT CASE WHEN" +
108        " 90000 <= CAST(current_setting('server_version_num') AS integer)" +
109        " THEN set_config('pljava.implementors', 'postgresql_ge_90000,' || " +
110        " current_setting('pljava.implementors'), true) " +
111        "END"
112    ),
113
114    @SQLAction(provides="postgresql_ge_90100", install=
115        "SELECT CASE WHEN" +
116        " 90100 <= CAST(current_setting('server_version_num') AS integer)" +
117        " THEN set_config('pljava.implementors', 'postgresql_ge_90100,' || " +
118        " current_setting('pljava.implementors'), true) " +
119        "END"
120    ),
121
122    @SQLAction(provides="postgresql_ge_90300", install=
123        "SELECT CASE WHEN" +
124        " 90300 <= CAST(current_setting('server_version_num') AS integer)" +
125        " THEN set_config('pljava.implementors', 'postgresql_ge_90300,' || " +
126        " current_setting('pljava.implementors'), true) " +
127        "END"
128    ),
129
130    @SQLAction(provides="postgresql_ge_100000", install=
131        "SELECT CASE WHEN" +
132        " 100000 <= CAST(current_setting('server_version_num') AS integer)" +
133        " THEN set_config('pljava.implementors', 'postgresql_ge_100000,' || " +
134        " current_setting('pljava.implementors'), true) " +
135        "END"
136    ),
137})
138public class ConditionalDDR { }
